title: Clorox Wins 2023 EPA Award for Advancing Green Chemistry - PR Newswire
summary: The Clorox Company received the 2023 Green Chemistry Award from the EPA for its EcoClean™ Disinfecting Cleaner, which is made with plant-based ingredients that effectively kill germs. This recognition is part of their broader commitment to environmental sustainability, including efforts to reduce hazardous substances and incorporate post-recycled plastic in packaging. Clorox's dedication to transparency and safer ingredient disclosure has also earned them the Safer Choice Partner of the Year award.
green_innovation: TRUE: The innovation reduces the generation and use of hazardous substances, promoting environmental sustainability through the use of plant-based active ingredients.
business_innovation: TRUE: The introduction of Clorox EcoClean™ Disinfecting Cleaner as a new product significantly differs from the company's previous offerings and is available in the market.
green_product: TRUE: Clorox EcoClean™ Disinfecting Cleaner is designed to minimize environmental impact through safer ingredients and sustainable packaging, fulfilling the criteria of a green product.
green_process: TRUE: The development of Clorox EcoClean™ involves sustainable practices, such as using plant-based materials and post-recycled plastics, which demonstrates a commitment to reducing environmental impacts.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 32561 - Soap and Other Detergent Manufacturing; 32532 - Pesticide and Other Agricultural Chemical Manufacturing; 32519 - Other Basic Organic Chemical Manufacturing; 42385 - Industrial Supplies Merchant Wholesalers
greenwashing: FALSE: The article does not indicate any misleading claims about the environmental benefits of Clorox products; rather, it highlights genuine achievements in sustainability and transparency.

title: Innovations from Cosmetic 360's 2023 edition - BW Confidential
summary: The Cosmetic 360 trade show in Paris showcased numerous innovations focused on Clean Tech, emphasizing eco-friendly brands with compostable packaging, locally sourced ingredients, and technologies promoting transparency in supply chains. Highlights included AI skin diagnosis tools, propellant-free whipped textures, and solid products designed for lower environmental impact. Key awards were given for innovations such as pea-based ethanol and cellulose-derived functional ingredients. Plans for expanding international support through a new 'embassy' in Shanghai were also announced.
green_innovation: TRUE: The innovations presented at the Cosmetic 360 trade show focus on sustainability, minimizing environmental impact, and promoting eco-friendly practices, which align with green innovation principles.
business_innovation: TRUE: The article discusses various new or improved products and processes introduced by companies at the trade show, meeting the definition of business innovation.
green_product: TRUE: Many of the products, such as those with compostable packaging and solid formulations, are designed to significantly reduce environmental impact throughout their life cycles.
green_process: TRUE: Multiple processes showcased, such as solid product formulation and supply chain transparency via QR codes, aim to minimize waste and environmental impacts, fitting the definition of green processes.
product_or_process: AI Skin Diagnostic tool, Solid Products
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 325620 - Toilet Preparation Manufacturing, 339114 - Dental Equipment and Supplies Manufacturing, 424210 - Drugs and Druggists' Sundries Merchant Wholesalers, 541715 - Research and Development in the Physical, Engineering, and Life Sciences (except Nanotechnology and Biotechnology).
greenwashing: FALSE: The article does not suggest misleading claims about environmental benefits; instead, it presents genuine innovations aimed at enhancing sustainability in the beauty industry.

title: Coffee biorefinery opened in Denmark to upcycle coffee grounds - FoodNavigator.com
summary: Kaffe Bueno's new biorefinery in Denmark aims to upcycle wasted coffee grounds into food and cosmetic products, preventing greenhouse gas emissions from the decomposition of the grounds. Backed by the European Innovation Council, the facility can process 500 tons of coffee grounds annually, with plans to expand to 1,500 tons. The biorefinery operates using green chemistry and biotechnology, significantly reducing emissions compared to traditional farming methods for ingredient sourcing. Kaffe Bueno also aims to establish additional biorefineries globally due to the plentiful supply of spent coffee.
green_innovation: TRUE. This innovation contributes to environmental sustainability by preventing emissions from coffee waste and utilizing a by-product to create valuable food and cosmetic ingredients.
business_innovation: TRUE. The establishment of a new biorefinery represents a significant improvement in the firm's processes and products, differentiating it from previous operations and introducing innovative methods to the market.
green_product: TRUE. The products derived from the biorefinery, such as prebiotic fiber and antioxidants, are designed to have a lower environmental impact and contribute positively to sustainability.
green_process: TRUE. The biorefinery utilizes green chemistry and biotechnology to convert waste into valuable products while minimizing environmental impact and reducing emissions.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 311999 - All Other Miscellaneous Food Manufacturing; 325611 - Soap and Other Detergent Manufacturing; 325199 - All Other Industial Chemical Manufacturing; 325320 - Pesticide and Other Agricultural Chemical Manufacturing
greenwashing: FALSE. There is no indication of misleading claims as Kaffe Bueno's processes and products genuinely focus on sustainability and reducing environmental impact.

title: CPHI Barcelona 2023 - Event preview - European Pharmaceutical Review
summary: CPHI Barcelona 2023 is an upcoming global pharma event scheduled from October 24-26, 2023, focusing on next-generation biomanufacturing, sustainability, and connecting industry professionals. The event will introduce new features such as The Start-Up Market to showcase innovative products and promote sustainability initiatives, including the use of renewable energy and waste reduction strategies. Additionally, it will celebrate advancements in the pharma industry with the 20th anniversary of the CPHI Pharma Awards and an extensive conference agenda on various relevant topics. CPHI emphasizes its commitment to sustainability and facilitating valuable connections among participants.
green_innovation: TRUE: The event focuses on sustainability, renewable energy usage, and reducing environmental impacts, aligning with the definition of green innovation.
business_innovation: FALSE: The article does not specify a new or improved product or business process but rather discusses the event itself.
green_product: FALSE: The article does not identify a specific good or service that meets the definition of a green product.
green_process: TRUE: The commitment to sustainable transportation, renewable energy use, and waste reduction during the event indicates a green process.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 541620 - Environmental Consulting Services, 541930 - Translation and Interpretation Services, 813920 - Professional Organizations, 611430 - Professional and Management Development Training.
greenwashing: FALSE: The article outlines genuine sustainability efforts and initiatives, without any misleading statements suggesting false environmental responsibility.

title: Top pharma companies 2023: A satisfactory year - PharmaLive
summary: As pharmaceutical companies shift focus from COVID-19, they are ramping up efforts in cancer and metabolic disease treatments, exploring innovative partnerships and acquisitions. Companies like Novo Nordisk and Amgen are acquiring firms to boost their pipelines with promising therapies, while also addressing challenges like the Inflation Reduction Act and climate change. Many companies are investing in sustainable practices, aiming for carbon neutrality and reduced environmental impact through various initiatives. Leadership changes have also occurred in several firms, coupled with ongoing efforts to adapt to regulatory changes and sustainability goals.
green_innovation: TRUE, as the article discusses the pharmaceutical industry's efforts to reduce their climate impact and pursue sustainability initiatives, contributing to environmental sustainability goals.
business_innovation: TRUE, as the article describes significant new product developments and strategic acquisitions within pharmaceutical companies that enhance their product pipelines.
green_product: FALSE, as the article does not specify any particular products that significantly reduce environmental impact, but rather discusses overall company goals and initiatives.
green_process: TRUE, as the article mentions companies aiming for carbon neutrality and sustainability practices in their operations, indicative of green processes being implemented.
company: Novo Nordisk, Amgen, Pfizer, Eli Lilly, Sanofi, Takeda, GSK, Merck & Co., AstraZeneca, Johnson & Johnson, and others.
product_or_process: INV-202, Tepezza, Krystexxa, EAPP, next-generation respiratory inhalers, and various therapeutic candidates.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 325412 - Pharmaceutical Preparation Manufacturing; 541711 - Research and Development in Biotechnology; 621511 - Medical Laboratories; 325414 - Biological Product (except Diagnostic) Manufacturing.
greenwashing: FALSE, as the article focuses on genuine efforts by pharmaceutical companies to innovate sustainably and enhance environmental responsibility, without indicating deceptive marketing practices.
